alert.note: Alert for Fremont (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 12 at 4:23PM MDT until June 15 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Riverton WY has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Wyoming... Wind River at Riverton affecting Fremont County. Wind River near Kinnear affecting Fremont County. ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity for the following rivers in Wyoming... Wind River near Crowheart affecting Fremont County. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt high mountain snowpack today, with high volumes of snowmelt moving through area rivers and streams over the coming two to three days. Expect high flows at least through the middle of the week. For the Wind River Basin...including Dubois, Crowheart, Kinnear, Riverton...Minor to Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wind River at Riverton. * WHEN...From this afternoon to Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Bankfull stage. Minor flooding downstream along left bank near Black Bridge begins. At 9.0 feet, Flood stage. Minor flooding along the right and left banks upstream of the Highway 789 Bridge. Agricultural flooding downstream of Riverton near the Black Bridge and Hidden Valley area intensifies. At 10.0 feet, Extensive agricultural flooding downstream of Riverton near the Black Bridge and Hidden Valley area. Water begins to encroach homes along the right bank. At 11.0 feet, Major flooding of homes along the right bank. Water begins to encroach low lying areas west of Highway 789. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:15 PM MDT Sunday the stage was 8.9 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to near moderate flood stage overnight with a maximum forecast stage of 10.9 feet after midnight tonight. It will then slowly decrease, eventually falling below flood stage late Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.1 feet on 06/10/2017. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when near riverbanks.
